website_summaries.verdict: With a high number of functions found in pro-grade multimeters and a lower price, it's by far the best choice if you want a top-notch budget deal.
pros: Leads the pack in value thanks to features and capabilities that compare to commercial-level tools: auto ranging, rugged build, sharp readout, and an impressive range of tests
cons: Lacks a few high-end features (like non-contact voltage testing)

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this meter today, set to Ω and touching leads together should give a reading of 0.0Ω. This meter does not, nor does it stay on a value at all. I tried the whole "relative" button thing and still, when you touch the leads together, I'm getting erratic values that don't stay on a single value, nor do they show 0.0Ω resistance. I'll be sending this meter back, hope this review saves someone else the trouble on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Coppolo

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's Choice!?  WTF Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that Amazon granted this product "Amazon's Choice" status. Incredible. Right out of the box had a ton of issues: -- backlight only stays on for 10 seconds or so. infuriating. you're always having to long-press to get it to stay on for any significant length of time. -- didn't measure voltage correctly (or at all) -- diode setting didn't work at all -- almost impossible to open stand without damaging device -- test lead covers are nearly impossible to get off and easy to damage actual leads by trying to remove covers w/ pliers. flabberghasted that this was recommended. will certainly make me think twice when seeing amazon's choice products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas E. Gavrilos

customer_reviews.title: Good spectrum of measurement abilities and high sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the capabilities of this quite reasonably-priced meter. Auto-ranging was an important feature for me and previously only available on more expensive products. This will be used for my lab applications (home experimenter) with electrochemistry and low-level voltage / current applications. As I need to design and build some of my 'bench-testing tech' this device's ability to test transistors, capacitors, frequency and temperature are ideal for these applications. Backlighting is quite bright which helps greatly in my not-so-well-lit lab. Definitely a good purchase decision.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Way better than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: My old multimeter bit the dust right when I needed it. I ordered this one mainly for the features, reviews and price. I thought it would be ok, but I didn't expect it to be this good. Very accurate with both DC and AC voltage, as well as measuring resistance. Continuity has an audible beep. This is a must for me. I was so pleased with this multimeter that I ordered the additional test leads kit, AstroAI Multimeter Electronic Test Leads Kit with Alligator Clips and Plunger Mini Hooks, Probes Upgraded To CAT IV, a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: kwc5776

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for basic home improvement and automotive testing!
customer_reviews.text: I typically use a multimeter for home and auto wiring, continuity testing and voltage readings. However, this meter has way more functions that I'll be learning to use and apply in my never ending honey-do list! AstroAI has really impressed me, not just with their inexpensive but useful tools, but also with their desire to serve the customer. They reached out before I'd posted this review just to inquire if I'd had any issues and wanted to proactively help. That type of customer dedication is what is missing from so many companies today. Kudos to AstroAI.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. Jasperson

customer_reviews.title: Capable multimeter for hobbyist or light to moderate duty at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the attractive feature set, including the usual multimeter ranges plus capacitance, frequency and temperature. It also has a "hold" feature to solve the jittery display problem that afflicts digital meters. I've now used it on several small projects, and it's turning out to be very capable. The display has a backlight which is very helpful for use in locations with poor illumination, and the meter has an "auto power off" feature to help extend the life of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.C

customer_reviews.title: A versatile do everything multimeter great bargain
customer_reviews.text: I am old enough to remember when a Simpson analogue multimeter was state of the art. The advent of integrated circuits and microprocessors has revolutionized multimeters. I like this model because it is a great value and has all the functions I would ever use. Its accuracy is as good as I need for my uses. It is encased in rubber as well so I would not fear of breaking it if I dropped it. Besides the case is non slip which making it easy to prop up whete I can see it when I have to reach with the probes then look over to see the reading
customer_reviews.author: E. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to see!
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and good packing. This is the third meter I have purchased from Amazon. This one is by far the easiest to use compared to the other two. Large display and an interesting dial which has a "stop" or "off" at both ends of the range so you won't have to keep going all the way back to the other end of the dial to shut it off. An interesting concept. Fairly accurate and easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Stokers

customer_reviews.title: I want to return the Volt Meter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something simple to use, instead I ordered a volt meter you need a four year degree to operate I just want to return the Item for a refund. It has not been used. I opened the package on the Volt meter but after looking at it, it was way over my untrained electoral mind. I am having some extensive back surgery on the 23d and will be in the hospital and rehab for about a month before I could ship it back. Please help to settle this matter. William
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Timeouts are way too short.
customer_reviews.text: The backlight timeout is way too short. If I want to leave the backlight on continuously, I should be able to. You don't even get one minute before the light automatically shuts off. Same story with the auto power off function. If you're already frustrated because your project isn't going smoothly and your are in a low light situation, you will end up smashing this meter. If you think you may find yourself in this situation, put the 30 bux towards something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I found a fuse supplier and now have spares.Astro techs has also sent new fuses. upgraded to five stars
customer_reviews.text: TheAstroAi Multimeter,TRMS 6000 does everything as advertised. A great product. Unfortunately, I blew the 400aM600V fuse. I have asked the Astro company for help finding a replacement fuse. The fuse has an unusual configuration and impossible to find in the usual places including Amazon. So far, no response from Astro and their web page offers no help. I received a letter after the purchase inviting questions and comments. The letter gave no way of submitting a question or getting help. So, I am still waiting for help.
customer_reviews.author: DMAHER

customer_reviews.title: If you want to measure temperature, maybe get a Fluke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to measure the subcool on my ac but this temp probe is not accurate at all. The instructions say that the temp prob has a tolerance of +/- 3 degrees Fahrenheit, which is pretty abysmal as is and not really good for any type of precise measuring but the one I got was consistently 4 Fahrenheit higher than actual temperature. I checked it against 3 different thermometers and had the same result with each. It may be great for the other functions but not for measuring temperature.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorCK

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The AstroAI multimeter was a total disappointment. Cheap plastic case, protected by cheap vinyl covering that sort-of attaches to the case. Contruction reminds me more of Fisher-Price than a quality electronics instrument. Doesn't look like it could survive a fall off a bench or transport in a tool box. The case is held together with too-short self-tapping screws which screw into brittle looking plastic. User protections are the bare minimum -- I would not use this with household mains voltages. The probes are typical Chinese quality. I wouldn't trust this thing either in accuracy or in safety. Maybe keep it around for the car or to test batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this meter because it had good reviews. Obviously false reviews paid for by the seller. First this meter will not take an accurate reading no matter what scale you choose. Second: The terminal leads suck and the plug connection to the meter is intermittent depending on the pin rotating on the socket. The amount of frustration this piece of crap has caused me is not worth what I paid for this supposedly good meter. IT SUCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Rogue Bull

customer_reviews.title: This one puts the “meh” in “meter”
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this meter, and to a small degree I still do, but I certainly wont buy another. This meter just feels cheap. The test leads are shockingly flimsy. The plastic case has sharp edges and just turning the selector dial makes a noise like dragging a sheet of plywood down a gravel driveway. (It really is that bad). BUT, it does have fairly decent accuracy in the volts/ohms department. So if you are a casual user looking for a good “beater” meter, this one will work, and at this price you wont particularly mourn its loss if it goes swimming or you drop it off a ladder. Tl;dr: Fair accuracy but has an awful fit/finish/feel.
customer_reviews.author: Roark

customer_reviews.title: Low cost meter with ample capabilities
customer_reviews.text: The meter arrived within 2 days of ordering, I didn't expect much given the price. I have always used Fluke meters and been very happy with them. My last meter was stolen and I need something quick to replace it. I figured I would look through the new models later and get another fluke. This one arrived in a very professional looking box. The meter feels pretty light, the cables are stiff and don't push in easily. The thermal couple seems to be off about 3-4 degrees. If you are looking for an inexpensive meter for basic troubleshooting and checking this will get the job done. If you need precision then get a more expensive meter.
customer_reviews.author: Hgrubbs

customer_reviews.title: Works well -- good value -- excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is the second multimeter I've owned. The first one held up for more than a decade of occasional use. I don't give them a lot of hard use; I'm a homeowner / DIY hobbyist. This meter is much larger and sturdier than my old one. I really like the display and the controls. Everything works as expected. The instructions for use won't win any prizes, but they're certainly adequate. When I had a question, customer service responded promptly and provided detailed information including multiple photographs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Test leads are not as photographed.
customer_reviews.text: Big disapointment on this item. They advertise it for electricians, but the test leads are unusable for testing outlets. The unit does not ship with the leads advertised in the picture. The metal end of the leads are barely 1/4 inch. Too short for testing electrical outlets. I returned item for credit.
customer_reviews.author: LJA

customer_reviews.title: Good Grade multimeter.
customer_reviews.text: This multimeter seems to be well made, you can tell it's made better than some of the lower priced ones. When I bought this multimeter I didn't expect it to be as high grade as it is because of the low price. As soon as the UPS driver handed it to me I could tell by the weight that it wasn't one of the cheaply made ones. If you're like me just a DIY person you will be pleased with this meter. Don't let the low price fool you, you'll get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Don Crow

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, even for what it costs, even on a lightning deal. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: This comes with NO pouch nor anywhere to put the accessories; of which, the probe protectors were NOT in my box. The box it came in is nearly impossible to open and close. This was to be a gift, but now I am embarrassed to do so. I will likely return. It's NOT even built well enough for the commercial armature. The blue and white extenders are super thin and covered in a wax. cloth type material- not cloth, not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Defective on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Item did not work on arrival. Display flickered even with nothing attached, it did not measure Hz, and it read 430V out of my 120V AC outlet. I sent it back. Company offered to send replacement. I declined the offer.
customer_reviews.author: jettepilot

customer_reviews.title: My First Decent Meter
customer_reviews.text: Got this for trouble shooting my 3D printer and other power supplies that I use for astronomy. Works well and appears to be accurate. I know method to confirm other than the expected values match the specs on the devices being checked. I had a basic Fluke many years ago that I used during and after electronics school. This certainly has quite a bit more functionality. I don't expect to use this meter very often so will be interested to see how it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: DaveA

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: In the picture you'll see why I keep it in my trailer. I use it a lot on lipos, etc. I bought this cause I'm trying to learn as much about electrical as I can and this thing has assisted me in my learning process greatly and allowed me to experiment at home. My truck broke down And one of the guys who pulled over to help push it off the road insisted that it was the battery that was the problem. Battery tested 12.64 volts even after we try to crank it a 100 times.
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: First test out of the box was the thermistor... in a 72 degree room it was reading 880. Moved to an ice water test and ICE water 30 minutes later 430. Not at all impressed. The magnetic back hold the strap but it misses the divots for the holder by a solid 1/4. I will rest voltage against a known standard for it is what it is a $25 almost close enough multimeter. I can't begin to under stand the good reviews unless the are mostly people who don't test their meters.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Canha

customer_reviews.title: Case, lighting, and stand are too cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I guess the old adage you get what you pay for holds true. I bought this MM to replace my old GREENLEE DM-20 ... everything worked on that old unit except diode testing. So this replacement unit was able to read the diode I had ... and I liked the auto ranging features ... but the casing was cheaply made, the lighting for the LCD is something out of a 1970’s arcade (should be LED) and the back stand would break in only a couple tries .... I’m sure it would work if I babied my stuff but knowing me, I decided to look for something a little more sturdily made
customer_reviews.author: TJF@Denver

customer_reviews.title: A Superb Experience
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this product sings. It is sturdy, nice looking, ergonomic, robust, and highly functional (as a "multi"-meter should be. I bought the $16 hard case to keep it in, safe from dust. I helped my friend diagnose and repair a fried GFI outlet, but didn't know what caused it to fail. Now I can stop worrying about the safety of my electrical appliances and circuitry. I am looking forward to years of service from this versatile "toy" (as my wife calls it.)
customer_reviews.author: Monty J Heying

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service! My multi-meter stopped working a few days ago, and after a quick email to Astro's customer service team, they are sending a replacement! Excellent service and very easy to deal with. Happy to find a company that will honor their product's warranty without making you jump through hoops. The multi-meter is great as well. The magnet is a real plus, and the large display is easy to read. I wish the back-light was easier and stayed on for more than a few seconds. Other than that, it's a great multi-meter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it will all the beeps
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Large display, large digits, 4 jacks, 10 amp range, accuracy specs are listed somewhere. Strap & magnets on back Cons: BEEPS. 1 display only. Display back lamps off in 7 seconds. Can't change default lamps off time or set beeps off. Did designer think all users are too stupid to know if finger pushed button or turned selector switch but know beeps? Returned first day. KAIWEETS Digital Multimeter TRMS 6000 Counts costs $4 more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lee Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter
customer_reviews.text: So far this multimeter has all the functionality I need. I did a lot of research before buying this tool and I read a number of great reviews and so far they have all been correct. I am currently learning Electronics as I am studying for my Extra License in Amateur Radio and want to apply the items I am learning. I also purchased the book "Make: Electronics" and the toolkit to perform the experiments. All in all a great meter for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keith S. Safford

customer_reviews.title: This meter is as advertised so far
customer_reviews.text: I am a ham radio licensee and have been in electronics since the 50s. This instrument has a couple of features that my other meters do not have. It seems to be well protected so I will be taking it out on field operations. I think it is good value. I have not used it extensively but it did arrive in a reasonable time and in excellent condition. If somebody wants a good DMM with some extra features like the counter (used that too) I can recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: wrcromwell

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money, perfect for hobbyists
customer_reviews.text: Is it as accurate as a multimeter 10 times the cost? I have no idea. What I do know is that it works, gives me good readings quickly, can test any type of test I need to test, and does it with the accuracy I need as a hobbyist. It feels stout, well made and sturdy. The main selector has a nice heavy click at each stop that doesn’t feel cheap. Some people complain about the beep at each selection but I don’t know why, it doesn’t bother me. It works and does what it does well.
customer_reviews.author: David Porter

customer_reviews.title: A very fine Volt/Ammeter and a great deal at the price.
customer_reviews.text: "For the price" is such a common classification but tends to impart a negative perception. Still, as a great volt/ammeter it has to be considered for the absolute DEAL this is. Auto-ranging, highly accurate, and easy to read with its illuminated screen (selective), I am very satisfied, happy to have chosen this particular unit. Moreover, the provided pull out stand makes it easily readable as it sits out of the way of the immediate work area. I confidently recommend this device for the serious technician.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Terrible documentation
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality multimeter. Voltage is the main function I will use, and that's pretty easy to figure out. I compared my results with that of a technician and they were the same. But the instructions for the multitude of other measurements it's capable of making leaves very much to be desired. Sure, it's technical in nature, but it's supposedly designed for the homeowner and DIY projects. The instruction "manual" (sheet, actually) appears to assume that the user will be a qualified professional electrician.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent meter for hobbyist!
customer_reviews.text: Weekend warrior getting back into the electronics hobby by building guitar pedals, rewiring guitars and setting the bias on tube amplifiers. This has all the settings you need for pedals and amps. Have an old cap and the value or number is worn off? No problem. Set it for capacitance and read get the value. Then mark it on the cap for later reference. The extra adapter for checking FET values and operation is a real bonus. I would recommend this meter.
customer_reviews.author: james w thomas III

customer_reviews.title: The only shortcoming:  the light goes off in 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: This multi-meter works well in every regard... except the display's background light. Maybe I am mis-using it, but the light automatically turns-Off after 10 (maybe 20) seconds after I turn it on. Very annoying. In fact... it's down-right frustrating! So, I'll bow to possible user-error but if so, why make that feature so unintuitive to use.. Sheesh! Otherwise, it's a fine unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-K

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: The Digital Autorange" feature eliminates decimal errors, large contrasting LCD readout very easy to read. Have used the included thermocouple on several projects. Thorough instructions, great value and quality. Switched out the (too short tipped~1/8") test leads with a longer set for my needs Now my go-to meter.!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Meter showing random digits
customer_reviews.text: This meter functions as described, but it shows random digits on the display until it locates the desired reading. This is annoying and sometimes confusing. Measuring 120 VAC, if the voltage is not present, the meter will display digits that have no bearing on the measurement. The meter for example will display 540 VAC when the 120 VAC is not present. There is no way the circuit would have that voltage. Most meters I have used will show zero or the correct voltage. The meter is also slow to display the reading when the reading is correct. Personally I would find another meter.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: it appears to be well made with very positive switch positions and nice packaging. However
customer_reviews.text: provides many of the functions I wanted in this replacement multi-meter. Having a temperature measurement was an added plus. At first look, it appears to be well made with very positive switch positions and nice packaging. However, the manual is very small and rather difficult to read. One item that I found missing was how to replace the battery. Removing the cover and looking for any obvious battery compartment I'm not finding anything. there are 2 screws holding the back case to the front, but I've not tried removing that to see if it opens to the battery. Overall, I like the meter and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hobby Multimeter
customer_reviews.text: I have used cheap(and 'free gift') multimeters for the longest time and always struggled with reliable results. Upgrading to this has opened my eyes. The ease of use and quality compared to 'cheap' models is unbelievable and the price difference is fairly insignificant when comparing between this and others that are 'cheaper' I am just a hobbyist, mostly small electronics and occasional small projects around the home and this has been an excellent addition to my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: ZReviews

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am just now teaching myself electronics and needed a decent multimeter to work my way through the process. This multimeter works on every setting I've tested it on and appears quite accurate. It arrived on time and as advertised. I can't speak for it as a professional tool as I don't n=know enough yet, but I think it is a great deal for any hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Rags2riches

customer_reviews.title: No longer measures voltage accurately, warranty replacement on it's way.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a few months, but after 6 months voltage measurements are now a fraction of the true value. It still seems to work for other functions but I can't trust it. I will have to get another brand and hope it is designed and built better. This is a very nice looking piece of junk. It does have a 36 month warranty and it was easy to get them to ship me a replacement. Due in a day or so...
customer_reviews.author: Boca Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fluke
customer_reviews.text: EEhh. Ok I guess .... I needed a meter with Duty cycle and this fit the bill cheaply. Im not really all that disappointed but this meter is a bit annoying with all its beeping and feels cheap. Kind of what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Luke L.

customer_reviews.title: Great hobbyist multimeter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little multimeter for hobbyist. It is not intended for a professional not because it's not accurate enough but because it's not durable enough. A professional could probably keep it around as a backup in a pinch. I have used this for everything from basic house repairs to electronic gadget repairs. It never fails to work well.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shockley

customer_reviews.title: Worlds best customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Had a cable arrive damaged. I reached out to astroai, and they worked hard to resolve my issue. I appreciate all of their time and effort into correcting the issue. The multimeter itself is beyond worth the money. So easy to use even a newbie could figure it out. Clear read even when outside, and easy functions. Update: I've had this unit for over a year now. Still works fantastic! Plus customer service is top knotch! Still remember how polite and eager they were to assist me with my issues.
customer_reviews.author: PandaPanPan

customer_reviews.title: Great Meeder for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little meter for the money. Lots of features and appears to be quite accurate. It has a magnetic strap attached to the case which makes it very simple to fix it to a panel board when taking readings. Nice. The leads could have longer points on them as they’re not long enough to be inserted into a standard receptacle. I Purchased a set of aftermarket leads to overcome the small deficiency.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great features/ build quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to use this mainly for smaller low voltage applications. Mainly musical instrument component testing. It’s a very solidly built unit with more than enough features for what I’ll be using it for. The only issue I may have is replacing the battery. It comes with one pre installed. I was going to put a brand new Duracell to know the age of what was in it from ground zero, but was unable to open the device without feeling like I might break it, so, I left the factory installed one in.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Did not read voltage below 5 volts accurately. Threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Comstock M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE !!!
customer_reviews.text: Had an item missing and contacted seller and received missing item within 2 weeks! Great customer service! Although its not a Fluke or HP it does the job and I really like the large display! Only thing that I do not like is that it times out too quick, hopefully they can change the firmware to add some more time?
customer_reviews.author: N8AUM

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery and support
customer_reviews.text: Received promptly, I had an issue with the continuity feature. I couldn't make it work. The instructions were not very helpful. I contacted the company and they sent a second meter through Amazon immediately. It works fine I would recommend this meter as easy to read, plenty of features and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with easy directions
customer_reviews.text: For someone who knows nothing about volts, meters this is a great little helper. The book and online videos avaialble show how to use this to check your car, or mower battery (why we needed it) and then we had fun checking AA, AAA and 9 volt (they are really 9 volts!) too. I do wish like other reviewers that they came with alligator clips as it took two of us to check out the zturn mower and if cable from battery was good. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie G.

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate and Many Features for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very accurate meter. I have tested it against a known perfect calibrated lab meter. This AstroAI is highly accurate compared to the high-end meter I have been using. The other meter cost me nearly $400. Yes, there are a couple things that make the other one 'better', but not in the measurement quality. A VERY nice meter to purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Digichip

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for price, good customer support
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price, decent stock leads. I may or may not have blown a fuse like a dummy shortly after receiving mine (remember Ohm's law, kids!), but Astro AI sent me replacement fuses at no cost. I was just emailing them to ask for a recommended replacement fuse I planned to pay for - they didn't have to do that since it was user error and not the company's fault. Delivery was free & prompt. Readings for ohms, amps, AC/DC volts, and capacitance seem to match expected values closely but have not tested extensively.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S. Ft Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and the display is well lit. It's as accurate as the fluke meter I use at work. For the price it's just the meter to have around the house /shop. Convenient carrying case.only had it for a couple of months so I can't attest to it's reliability or life span.
customer_reviews.author: blane brown

customer_reviews.title: Seems good considering price
customer_reviews.text: I've measured AC and DC voltage with it. Worked as expected. Capacitance measurement worked but did not show the expected value for the two capacitors that I checked. I did not prove the measurement inaccurate. Overall I think this is okay for a lot of home uses especially for the price. I would probably buy a much better meter if I needed something for a professional job.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoHome1

customer_reviews.title: Nicely laid out but cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy seems to be fine. Many features. Probes Are terrible. Had to buy a set of probes that go with them meter. that jacked up the price to another league of meters. Meter is bulky and not easy to handle but other than that it seems fine. Keep in mind what your total cost will be if you have to go for set of probes.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna

customer_reviews.title: Nice Meter...too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Meter just for checking voltage and such. It is too sensitive for what I'm using it for. the numbers don't stop changing. I should have gone with a simple "needle" meter...but I tried this one. It's a nice meter probably for an electronics bench. But not for an electrician to use wiring a house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool. I am not a professional but, for working on cars and general household use this is the ticket. Obviously, it’s not a fluke but definitely a decent unit for the non professional. I like the temp taking ability as well. Overall, a good unit. Only complaint would be a general data and use explanation and or better instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P.

customer_reviews.title: Forget Fluke !
customer_reviews.text: I cant add enough stars for this meter. For years I gave used Flukes at work and home but when one of the guys at work ( we are all in Aviation ) Flukes died we looked for a comparable meter that didn't break the bank. We FOUND it! These are as good as Flukes. Just as sensitive , just as accurate. The whole hanger is now buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Nowlan

customer_reviews.title: Great meter
customer_reviews.text: This is my first "digital" meter (I have several 40+ year-old analog ones) and I'm liking it so far. I did remove the magnetic strap because it seemed to stick to everything on my bench (they are *strong*, but frankly I don't trust magnets to hold anything other than clippings on my refrigerator...).
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Shields

customer_reviews.title: Great Multimeter!
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy the cheapo HF multimeters... Yes, plural. They aren't worth it for $6 if you have to replace them for breaking 4 times over. Just get this one. It's a decent tool, and it's got the features you wanted but may not have justified before. Save your money, buy this, don't make the same mistakes I made.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: This meter beat my Fluke in a couple of ways.
customer_reviews.text: I have a $450 Fluke meter, but it was not able to measure capacitance in the range of the Dual Run capacitors that I need to measure on HVAC systems. This inexpensive meter was able to measure it. Plus, for a meter that I carry around in my truck, I’d rather keep my fluke in the shop, and instead use this meter. I can replace a $32 meter instead of a $450 meter if it gets banged around.
customer_reviews.author: KevinMISC

customer_reviews.title: The "Multi" multimeter!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice meter. Heavy duty and full of features! I haven't used them all at this point but this is a nice meter with really nice probes. I've been doing some Air conditioner work and the capacitance readings are dead on and it's handy to just attach the magnets to a metal enclosure and readings are right there where you can actually see them. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: great value and flexibility
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, it has already paid for itself doing my own hvac diagnosis. I needed a capacitance tester and my old multimeter that could not do that is now my backup. Not sure if voltage is super accurate since i see minor differences against my old unit, one is off a little but close enough. The magnetic hangar is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Faubus

customer_reviews.title: Great portable or bench meter tons of features!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tons of features measurements are accurate Came with high quality test leads (you have to trim the probe tips to desired length) has a built in stand (it sits on my bench at work mostly but it’s also very portable For working on larger projects. great customer support (they emailed me checking to make sure I was happy with the unit ) For the price I don’t think there is a better deal around
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Dead does not power on
customer_reviews.text: dead on arrival, did not work, dont waste your time
customer_reviews.author: matthew carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Multimeter and Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The Multimeter is of very high quality and the auto-ranging feature works flawlessly. I initially had a slight issue with authorizing the extended warranty and entered a review reflecting my displeasure. However, AstroAI immediately responded and took action. They fixed the hiccup in their internet site, authorized my extended warranty, and reimbursed the full purchase price of the Multimeter to my account!! I have NEVER had this happen and I have never experienced such a kind, professional and responsive Customer Service Department!!
customer_reviews.author: GL Dean

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Specs at the price
customer_reviews.text: I own Fluke and Beckman meters, the AstroAI TRMS 6000 is a very good meter. For basic measurements, it seems to be an outstanding meter. Feels good in the hand, display is very easy to read, meter controls are smooth and positive. For an under $40 meter, it is a fine deal.
customer_reviews.author: M Harris

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: It is a pretty accurate meter. The plastic housing could be a little sturdier, but it's what you expect at this price point. If you are not going to be abusing this unit, it should last a good long time. The readings are very close to my other meters.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Fluke but wanted to get something newer with current capability. Having the ability to read temperature is a nice bonus although seldom used. Since this only reads to 10A, I also bought AstroAI's current meter. Happy to have a set that should last me another 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Probe tips are way to short to reach into standard 110v receptacle.
customer_reviews.text: Probe tips are way too short, cannot reach many places with these probe tips.. poor design probe tips. Instruction are not well written
customer_reviews.author: H. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Greatr meter
customer_reviews.text: This meter did exactly what I wanted it to do. My trolling motor was not working and I needed to find out why. This helped me identify the problem and fix it quickly. It measures the voltage accurately and gives me a reading. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, backlit screen. Need to click mode to activate continuity siren.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I like how big the numbers are and how the screen illuminates. What I dont like is that everytime I want to do a siren continuity test I have to click mode to select audible siren. Please click helpful if this was of any use to you thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Fc3sluis

customer_reviews.title: Great price very nice multimeter.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice multimeter, I was looking at the yellow brand,but I thought the prices quoted were quite a bit higher and I did not think that you got much more meter, just the name. This meter will do all I ask for a fraction of the price. Other reviews complained about the meter beeping each time you change settings, in a maintenance repair shop setting the tiny little beeps make absolutely no difference. I bought this meter for real work, I think it is tough enough for everyday bumps and thumps.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, reliable and quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: So first off I'm a hard core buyer I review the hell out of an item if I'm not sure about the brand or quality. So after reviewing tons and tons of multimeters that ranged from $9.99-$129.99 I came across this one in particular the DM6000AR, I had seen this model make the top ten list of meters that were extensively reviewed, and it made the number one spot many times for reliability, accuracy and durability. We'll this meter hasn't disappointed, it's easy to read, extremely accurate, built well and strong and very reliable. Great tool for anyone who needs an affordable reliable quality meter..
customer_reviews.author: Mountaineer3O4

customer_reviews.title: Good meter at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a multi meter for 40+ yrs. so am familiar with them. Like the large display on this one and seems to be accurate compared to my Sperry analog meter. The one thing I wish it had is an ohms symbol on the dial that had multiple options such as rx1,rx10 rx100, etc. If the auto ohms scale proves accurate I will use that and it will actually be easier. Overall a fine meter for the price so far.
customer_reviews.author: dale

customer_reviews.title: A Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: So far, good. It performs as advertised and comes with more attachments than I needed but I am sure I'll find uses for it's capabilities and attachments in the future. It is also a good price for a quality digital multimeter. The magnet on the strap attaches to the back or another surface and I imagine is very convenient if working in tight quarters or under something with a metal surface.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT works Fine and quick
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a few times since it arrived a few weeks ago. I like meters to give the reading quickly like my Fluke 77 and this is comparable. Vales appear to be accurate for what I use meters for repairing ham radios and test instruments. I was curious about the capacitor reading and found it read exactly the same values as my Capacitance Meter. Best of all it had a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: norme name

customer_reviews.title: Read the Spec''s Before You Order
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this instrument specially to set up the "frequency" (cycles) of a generator. The frequency range of the instrument only goes up to 50 Hz, making it useless in the USA, since our standard frequency is 60 cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Good for the handyman and a good price?
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE USED OTHER VOLTAGE METERS THAT DOESN'T HAVE THE MEANS TO READ AND ABLE TO SEE CLEARLY WHAT YOU ARE LOOKING TO READ.BUT THIS METER HAS A BIGGER SCREEN AND EASIER TO USE.FOR THE PRICE OF THE METER AND THE VOLTAGE RANGE THIS IS A GOOD METER.
customer_reviews.author: lpdavis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, large display, well built
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a well-built multimeter. I’ve only used it to measure 240VAC so far, but it read it accurately and the display is nice and large and easy to see, even in daylight. The only reason I gave it four stars for accuracy is because I’ve only made the one measurement so far.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Robine

customer_reviews.title: TRMS 6000 Multimeter
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that I had my doubts but it's a work horse so far so good. I'm a DIY and do not use it every day more like three of four times a month. I believe that I'll be getting a good long service from this unit.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and i have recommend them to others. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a backup meter, but I interchange this meter with my old trusty Fluke and never give it a second thought. The thermocouple isn't calibrated exactly right, but its an "extra" anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Techspec

customer_reviews.title: Mine was reading inconsistently - but....
customer_reviews.text: The meter was all over the place, but it could have been our old house that was the problem. We followed instructions, not sure if there were just too many other wires near by or what the deal was. Ultimately we felt safer hiring an electrician come by.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable performance for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Short form: The WH5000A gives remarkable performance for the money. I needed a multimeter that could measure microvolts and microamperes, and the WH5000A does the job well at a fraction of the cost of other less capable multimeters. I admit that I haven't yet used all the other features (frequency, temperature, capacitance...) but it's nice to know they're there. Two minor wishes for a future version: - It would be great if there was a way to disable the Auto Power Off beep. (I do embedded systems design in my home lab, and I don't want to wake the family when I work late...) - Perhaps the next user manual could be printed a bit larger? :)
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Star

customer_reviews.title: Great meter.
customer_reviews.text: Lost my fluke and needed a replacement, the cost and style of this was alluring. Has tons of features and the support group is awesome. 3 year warranty and a company that cares and stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I am a home owner and engineer. As an engineer, I would love a Fluke meter, but for a home owner, they are just not needed. The AstroAI meter I bought is very well designed and quite versatile. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good for a cheap meter
customer_reviews.text: Would not trust it on high power but for most things it does the job. This is the one I travel with because most of the time I'm tracing out wires. If I loose it oh well I'm not out $300. On high power I use a Fluke or a Simpson meter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grisdale

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, not really good, but useable
customer_reviews.text: The numbers are big but low contrast. The plastic cover is cheap. The shape outside design is unstable, every time I want to turn the knob I have to hold both hand. In general nothing to says when it is cheap
customer_reviews.author: Nhan A. Tran

customer_reviews.title: New Multi-meter
customer_reviews.text: Received it today and used it immediately. Great meter, easy to use nicely laid out. Even the readout is large so I dont need my glasses. This meter replaces a 30 year old analog Triplett. What took me so long!! Highly recommended and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug570

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this multimeter to replace a 30 year + Radio Shack one that works, but was limited in capabilities. For the price this is a great tool. I am a 75+ year old handyman and I'm always testing batteries, electric circuits, appliances and automotive electronics....this meter will do it all for me. Very well constructed and should last for many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Seems good, instructions are very sparse
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good multimeter, worked right out of the box. I am very new to electronics so I do not know 100% how to use one, and the instructions do not enlighten much. With a little help I was albe to do what I needed, but I think they could use a little more information as it’s not obvious to a new user.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin McCall

customer_reviews.title: works well for us.
customer_reviews.text: The product is of excellent quality. The manual does not explain the controls. For a person who is an electrician the manual and symbols would be easy to read. For those of us who are not that well educated in electronics, it is difficult to decipher. The manual needs to be in layman's terms. Explanation of symbols on device such as OEMS, AC/DC.
customer_reviews.author: cal brethauer

customer_reviews.title: A good starter multimeter
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good multimeter for general use around the house or for beginner electrical engineering uses. It has allot of functionality beyond a typical multimeter such as frequency, thermocouple, RL, and even transistors. With all the things it can measure for the price it’s a solid buy. It’s not to most accurate meter out there but for the price I think you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Salman hussain

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-one Meter
customer_reviews.text: I think the auto power off is one of the best features. No more dead meter because I didn't turn it off.. Also appreciate the size of text on the meter and screen. I'm confident I'll be using this meter for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Davis

customer_reviews.title: the beeping is absurd, no markings on the dial
customer_reviews.text: pick some other meter that has readable labels on the selector control, it takes an extra 10 minutes to figure out what the dam thing is set on... this meter needs redesigned.My cheap harbor freight meter is actually easier top use , has no BEEPING and has the selector positions labeled. I give this meter a complete FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: dave beall

customer_reviews.title: You get  what you pay  for
customer_reviews.text: it seems a little weak i am a auto tech and use it often just seems to lack something just cant put my finger on it , this will work for people who use it once in a while but i don't recommend everyday use
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: this is the best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: I couldnt stand the "auto" only meters, the ones I have tried picked up too much background noise to be accurate when working with sensetive electronics in the single volt DC range. this is the best of both worlds, auto when I need it (never) and manual when I dont (always).
customer_reviews.author: josiah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read the large display!
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and easy to use with a the dial to select functions and the buttons to further refine the selected functions. I like the magnetic holder to keep the meter in place and visible.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a very good value. It was delivered on time and in good condition. All of the functions that I have tested so far work as expected and with acceptable accuracy. No drawbacks that I can see so far. Of course, what really matters with bargains like this is their longevity - will it work as well 5 or 10 years hence? Only time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Pardi

customer_reviews.title: Great meter at a great price
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: after posting the review below, AstroAI customer service emailed me and offered a replacement. The thermocouple function works perfectly on the new unit. I am now completely satisfied with the product and very happy with the company’s customer service. Seems to work well for the most part, so it’s a good value. However, straight out of the box the thermocouple function doesn’t work. It constantly reads a little below room temperature, whether the thermocouple is plugged in or not, or in the fridge vs. in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: P. Baumgartner

product_meta.title: AstroAI Digital Multimeter, TRMS 6000 Counts Volt Meter Manual and Auto Ranging; Measures Voltage Tester, Current, Resistance, Continuity, Frequency; Tests Diodes, Transistors, Temperature
product_meta.description:
The AstroAI True RMS Multimeter is designed to be safely and accurately used by professionals in a commercial setting or weekend DIYer's that need a little more power utility from their standard digital multimeter. It's easy and safe to operate with advanced features built for measuring seemingly everything. Run tests on diodes and transistors while being able to measure voltage, current, resistance, continuity, capacitance, and frequency, all on one device. This multimeter is designed to be used in commercial settings, but can also be brought home to use with automotive or household electrical problems. 

Specifications
Digital Display: 5 ¾ , 6000
Sampling Speed: 2 times per second
Range Selection: Auto or Manual

Polarity Indication
Overload Indication
Low Battery Indication
Power: 1 x 9V 6F22 Battery Included

Temperature Test: Yes
Transistor Test: Yes
Diode Test: Yes
Continuity Test: Yes
External Current Test: Yes
Capacitance: Yes
Frequency: Yes

Safety/Compliances: EN61010-1 CAT III 600V, CATII 1000V
DC Voltage: 600mV/6V/60V/600V ±(0.8%+3), 1000V (1%+5)
AC Voltage: 600mV ±(1.2%+8); 6V/60V/600V ±(1.2%+6); 750V ±(1.2%+8)
Temperature: -40°C~1370°C; -40°F~2000°F (1-5%+4 depending on temp)
DC Current: 600μA/6000μA/60mA/600mA ±(0.8%+5); 6A/10A ±(1.5%+3)
Transistor hFE: PNP & NPN (lb≈2μA; Vce≈1V)
Resistance: 600Ω/6KΩ/60KΩ/600KΩ/6MΩ ±(1.5%+3); 60MΩ ±(1.5%+5)
Capacitance: 60nF/600nF/6μF/60μF/600μF/60mF
Frequency: 0~60MHz ±(1%+5)

Package Includes
1 x AstroAI DM6000AR True RMS Digital Multimeter
1 x Test Leads (Pair)
1 x K-Type Thermocouple
1 x Multi-Function Socket
1 x User Manual
feature_bullets: WIDE RANGE of tests for Voltage, Current, Resistance, Continuity, Capacitance, Frequency; Tests Diodes Transistors, Temperature.
PROFESSIONAL LEVEL features include Auto-Ranging capability, and True RMS for measuring both AC Current and Voltage
EASE OF USE: Convenient features like Data Hold, Large LCD Backlit Screen, Auto Shut-off and Hanging Magnet, and Kickstand make taking and recording measurements easier than ever before
IDEAL FOR COMMERCIAL settings where it can handle the demands of a long workday, from the durable exterior to the wide range of heavy-duty capabilities

Built-in F400mA/600V and F10A/600V explosion-proof ceramic fuse tubes; Double Protection, more secure and reliable; The fuses can protect the multimeter effectively; Overload protection on all ranges. 3 Year Warranty provided by AstroAI. Note: Please take off the cap before using the test leads.

specifications.Special Features: ✓6000 Counts True RMS Digital Multimeter ✓Auto Ranging ✓AC/DC Voltage ✓AC/DC Current ✓Resistance ✓Diode ✓Continuity ✓Frequency ✓Transistors ✓Temperature ✓hFE ✓Overload Protection ✓Data Hold ✓Backlight Display ✓Low Battery Indication ✓Hanging Magnet and Kickstand
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,152 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
